applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Use http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql#gmlLiteral as a data type.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Geometry expressed in WKT format.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Geometry expressed in WKT format.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Use http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql#wktLiteral as a data type.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Combination of a string and the type of what the string represents.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. '20170901' as a string and 'date' as a type. Allows automatic interpretation of the string.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Combination of a string and the language in which its content is written.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. 'Rue Mercator' as a string and 'fr' as a language.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A location can be an identifiable geographic location (ISO 19112), but this location can also be a non-geographic location, such as a directory, row, or column.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Indication of a geographical position, by means of coordinates, a toponym, an address label, a reference to a city/region or reference to an address.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: To be used if the way in which the geographical position is indicated will only be determined upon implementation. If this way is already known, then you have to work directly with Geometry, GeographicName, Address, etc.

Indication of a quantity.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: In practice the primitive data types with which a quantity can be indicated, see xsd data types float, double, decimal, integer etc.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The closing hours of the place or service on the specified days of the week.
Day of the week for which the opening hours are valid.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: See https://schema.org/DayOfWeek for a list of possible values.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Typically, the duration follows from the specified start and end times.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Start of the duration.
End of time.
Information such as email, telephone, address that allows you to contact someone or something.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. a person or organization or service... Possible forms of contact: calling, emailing, etc.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Address that can be written to or visited.
E-mail address to which one can send e-mail.
Fax number to which one can fax.
Period in which contact can be made.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. indication of the season in which contact can be made. Start and end date according to ISO8601 syntax.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Name of e.g. the person you can contact.

vocabularyDefinition.en: A structured value that provides information about the opening hours of a particular place or a service within a particular place.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Hours within which contact can be made.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: Syntax according to schema.org for opening hours. E.g. if contact can be made between 8 a.m. and 8 p.m. Monday to Saturday and between 8 a.m. and 6 p.m. on Sunday, this will be coded as Mon-Sat 08:00-20:00, Sun 08:00-18:00.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Website to which one can surf.
Telephone number to which one can call.
Title used to address, address or refer to someone.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. Mr./Madam, Your Excellency, Doctor...

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Indication of the quantity of a particular characteristic of an object.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: E.g. the height of an object, the weight, the temperature, etc. It is a characteristic that can be expressed numerically and in a certain unit. Qualitative designations such as high, low, etc. are therefore not included.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: The standardized unit in which the value is expressed.
